intro: Lotononis sparsiflora, commonly known as the sparse-flowered lotononis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
